subject: GRRM is Coming to France & Switzerland
event:
Hey all you European Fans, GRRM is officially on his way to France tomorrow, he will be signing books at the lovely Librairier Grangier bookstore in Dijon from 2PM -6PM on Thursday July 3rd.

http://www.librairie-grangier.com Then after a short visit in France, it's off to beautiful Switzerland and the Neuchâtel International Fantastic Film Festival, or NIFFF, which GRRM will be attending from July 5th to July 12th.  During this wonderfully weird event highlighting fantastic films from all over the world they will feature three movies personally picked by George,  Hitchcock's PSYCHO, CASABLANCA and of course the forever classic FORBIDDEN PLANET.  GRRM will be introducing all three of these features and giving a short speech as to the influence these particular films had on him. GRRM will also be hosting a panel about being an author, working in television and the overall adaptation process.  The Panel is listed as the Writer's Room at NIFFF and is being scheduled for Monday the 7th of July at 2PM. There will also be a signing session for fans during NIFFF it beings at 2PM on Sunday July 12th. Please visit NIFFFs website for more details on all the fun happening in Neuchâtel this July.

http://www.nifff.ch

This Announcement has been brought to you by the Minions of Fevre River…. :)

comments.article:
Dijon...

How did you come to choose this city?

I hope that your next trip in France will be in Paris :P
No, it's great! Easily reachable from a wide part of the country! I'm soooo tempted. There's probably going to be too many attendees for it to be worthwhile, though.
Isn't July 12th will be a Saturday not a sunday?? (The signing session)
comments.subject: Date correction

comments.article: Thank you Minions, and best wishes and travels, George - have a great time! Travel well and safely and looking forward to any coverage.
every time I see "Neuchatel"  I think of Neufchatel Cheese.  :)
I have the hope that one day you will come to Mexico, that would be neat. I really do, when are you going to come to Mexico George?

comments.article:
I'm coming to see you :)) At least I hope that I will. In that article there was no mention on your 'Masterclass 'on the 10th of July at 3 pm but I guess it's still on (hope) Because getting a ticket for that was really a piece of workI can tell you :D
Can't wait however! It's so nice of you to come to your fans all over the world. I'm very grateful!!
Masterclass still on yeah. I wrote to the festival yesterday to get more infos, don't worry :-)
comments.subject: Masterclass

comments.article:
Switzerland! So close to us, to the wonderful Italy!

Cheers George, we want you to came back here to drink some wine and have a great dinner!!
comments.subject: Italy

comments.article:
No detour by Paris ? Too bad. Great city. Great fans. It is known. Anyway, safe trip.

(Sorry if I'm off topic but where does the 1st image come from? I find it amazing...)

Hello George!

I have one question: are you planning to come to Argentina in the near future?
Here, there is a legion of fans growing more and more each year and the Song of I&F events are numerous. Personally, I am a great lover of all your work, I write a lot and I am longing to meet you.

Thank you very much for reading.

Alex.
comments.subject: Visit to Argentina.

comments.article: I could not believe that the most amazing author of our time will come to Europe. Well, the wrong countries I would say but it is a very good start. Hope that GRRM will come to Germany next time. I would rly like to the him in action =)
comments.subject: Wow

comments.article:
Mr Martin,

I've been meaning to ask you this for a long time: how do you find the time to hop between all these acivities, edit those new books you've been launching and also focus on writing the newest (and plot-dense) stories of ASOIAF?

As a student who has had to multi-task during the latest years of my life, I find it truly amazing. How do you manage to "keep the noise out" when you finally find the time to sit down and continue writing the story?

Kind regards,
J Matias
comments.subject: How do you find the time?

comments.article:
Dear George,
Have a fantastic time in Dijon - my home town - a place rich in history, no doubt you have come across the Dukes of Burgundy in your historical research, from John the Good to the Fearless and the Bold... Beautiful architecture and amazing food, worth travelling (and stopping!) by the Route des Grands Crus, you will find some of the best wines in the world, worthy of a comparison to the Arbor!
Enjoy your travels, may it bring you plenty of inspiration!
comments.subject: Dijon

comments.article: Sounds like a fun trip!  Have a great time!

Hi there,
Given the major cry heard from the fans of the show (including me, I confess) with the absence of that certain character, I thought I'd take this opportunity to tell you how much I appreciate what you did (on the book). That character was, since the scene with the wolf, one of my very favourites, though I didn't love that one as much as I still love Jon, whom I relate to a good deal more, I gave a silent cheer everytime I saw that name written on the top of the page at the beginning of each chapter.

I have this nasty habit of taking a quick look at the last page every time I start a book (I'll stop it, I swear), so when that mid-book scene happened, I had hope still. And yet the epilogue made me no less happy. I'd just like to say that after making me so damn angry and making me so happy and vengeful and happy to be vengeful, you made me be disgusted with myself, and still a bit vengeful. You give the reader a thirst for revenge and then take that away, and show him/her how revenge is grim.

And that's just brilliant. Thank you very much for this, you are a master storyteller.

By the way, I love A Feast for Crows, I think it's actually brilliantly moody, like a deserted battlefield after the battle, filled with corpses [feeding crows]. It seems just right after a storm of swords.
comments.subject: Not a rant (I promise)

comments.article: It'd be so awesome if you could come to Italy. I'm looking forward to meet you sooner or later! :)
Has George taken to speaking in the third person or does someone else have access to this LJ?

At the end of the entry:

"This Announcement has been brought to you by the Minions of Fevre River..."

In other words, it was posted by his "minions" (i.e., assistant(s)). :)

Dear GRRM,

Do you feel that if the show had started earlier a la the time of Harry Potter, then you would have won a HUGO? Always felt that JK Rowling benefited greatly from the popularity of the movie series and the child stars and that helped propel her books to even greater heights.
comments.subject: Show Earlier

comments.article: The minions keep it all clean and on track - they are to be applauded...
comments.subject: Minions are cool...

comments.article:
As a Californian living and working in Dijon, I cannot tell you how excited I am that you're chosen to visit us here in 'Capitale du duché de Bourgogne'.

I'll certainly be braving the forecast storms (been a dry spring/summer...up until last weekend!) to come out for the visit.

Be sure to get in a few meals while you're here!
comments.subject: Hopefully the weather will cooperate
